member.name: M:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerBuilder.Weknow#EventSource#Backbone#IProducerBuilder#Merge(Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.Building.IProducerHooksBuilder,Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.Building.IProducerHooksBuilder,Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.Building.IProducerHooksBuilder[])
member.summary: Merges multiple channels of same contract into single producer for broadcasting messages via all channels.

member.name: M:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerBuilder.Weknow#EventSource#Backbone#IProducerPartitionBuilder#Partition(System.String)
member.summary: Partition key represent logical group of event source shards. For example assuming each ORDERING flow can have its own messaging sequence, yet can live concurrency with other ORDER's sequences. The partition will let consumer the option to be notify and consume multiple shards from single consumer. This way the consumer can handle all orders in central place without affecting sequence of specific order flow or limiting the throughput.

member.name: M:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerBuilder.Weknow#EventSource#Backbone#IProducerShardBuilder#Shard(System.String)
member.summary: Shard key represent physical sequence. Use same shard when order is matter. For example: assuming each ORDERING flow can have its own messaging sequence, in this case you can split each ORDER into different shard and gain performance bust..

member.name: M:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerBuilder.Weknow#EventSource#Backbone#Building#IProducerHooksBuilder#UseSegmentation(Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.IProducerAsyncSegmentationStrategy)
member.summary: Register segmentation strategy, Segmentation responsible of splitting an instance into segments. Segments is how the producer sending its raw data to the consumer. It's in a form of dictionary when keys represent the different segments and the value represent serialized form of the segment's data.
member.example: Examples for segments can be driven from regulation like GDPR (personal, non-personal data), Technical vs Business aspects, etc.

member.name: M:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerBuilder.Weknow#EventSource#Backbone#Building#IProducerHooksBuilder#UseSegmentation(Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.Building.IProducerSegmentationStrategy)
member.summary: Register segmentation strategy, Segmentation responsible of splitting an instance into segments. Segments is how the producer sending its raw data to the consumer. It's in a form of dictionary when keys represent the different segments and the value represent serialized form of the segment's data.
member.example: Examples for segments can be driven from regulation like GDPR (personal, non-personal data), Technical vs Business aspects, etc.

member.name: M:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerBuilder.Weknow#EventSource#Backbone#Building#IProducerSpecializeBuilder#Build``1
member.summary: Ceate Producer proxy for specific events sequence. Event sequence define by an interface which declare the operations which in time will be serialized into event's messages. This interface can be use as a proxy in the producer side, and as adapter on the consumer side. All method of the interface should represent one-way communication pattern and return Task or ValueTask (not Task<T> or ValueTask<T>). Nothing but method allowed on this interface
member.typeparam: The contract of the proxy / adapter

member.name: T:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerParameters
member.summary: This class is a bucket of parameters which built-up by the producer builder. It will used to define the producer execution pipeline.

member.name: P:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerParameters.Partition
member.summary: Partition key represent logical group of event source shards. For example assuming each ORDERING flow can have its own messaging sequence, yet can live concurrency with other ORDER's sequences. The partition will let consumer the option to be notify and consume multiple shards from single consumer. This way the consumer can handle all orders in central place without affecting sequence of specific order flow or limiting the throughput.

member.name: P:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerParameters.Shard
member.summary: Shard key represent physical sequence. Use same shard when order is matter. For example: assuming each ORDERING flow can have its own messaging sequence, in this case you can split each ORDER into different shard and gain performance bust..

member.name: P:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerParameters.SegmentationStrategies
member.summary: Segmentation responsible of splitting an instance into segments. Segments is how the producer sending its raw data to the consumer. It's in a form of dictionary when keys represent the different segments and the value represent serialized form of the segment's data.
member.example: Examples for segments can be driven from regulation like GDPR (personal, non-personal data), Technical vs Business aspects, etc.

member.name: F:Weknow.EventSource.Backbone.ProducerParameters.Routes
member.summary: Routes are sub-pipelines are results of merge operation which can split same payload into multiple partitions or shards.
